intro: Pholidota longibulba, commonly known as the long-bulb pholidota, is a unique flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, elongated floral buds that remain closed for a prolonged period before opening. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a leathery texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Pholidota longibulba is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
